https://prez.dev/description.@value: The primary purpose for which a borehole was drilled or any secondary purpose that the borehole may acquire during its lifecycle. The vocabulary focuses on drilling purposes within the resources industry, with a focus on terminology as applied in the Geological Survey of Western Australia (GSWA) databases. Some terms covered by jurisdictional legislation are highlighted in the provenance field. Variations in terminology within definitions (i.e. usage of borehole, well and wellbore) stem from usage in different sectors of the resources industry, but for the purpose of this vocabulary are considered to be equivalent. In the context of this vocabulary, the term fluid energy refers to sources such as gas, petroleum and geothermal, as covered by the Petroleum Legislation Amendment Act 2024, and is exclusive of mineral sources of energy (e.g. coal, uranium).

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: A borehole drilled for the intentional recharge of an aquifer under controlled conditions for subsequent recovery, demonstrable environmental benefit, or mitigation of the impacts of abstraction. This recharge must be an additional contribution to an aquifer, not a return of abstracted water.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#hist.@value: Department of Water and Environmental Regulation 2021, Policy: Managed aquifer recharge in Western Australia: Department of Water and Environmental Regulation, Joondalup, 18 p., https://www.wa.gov.au/system/files/2021-01/Policy_Managed_aquifer_recharge_in_Western_Australia.pdf

https://prez.dev/description.@value: A borehole drilled for the intentional recharge of an aquifer under controlled conditions for subsequent recovery, demonstrable environmental benefit, or mitigation of the impacts of abstraction. This recharge must be an additional contribution to an aquifer, not a return of abstracted water.
